intro: Anthospermum aethiopicum var. tulbaghense, commonly known as the Tulbagh lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces a basal rosette of narrow, sword-shaped leaves and has a fibrous root system. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The flowers typically bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
